column5: Well, its that time of year again. My internal clock has changed from chasing fish to hunting fauna. I decided to take the boat out one last time on saturday to run a little fuel stabalizer through the system, and brough along a few rods as well. Was only out for a few hours but the fishing was great. Landed a few small pike, and dozens of agressive smallies. Very surprising considering the water temp was hovering around 50. Ended the day early as my hands started to stiffen up. I could barely grip onto these two brutes for the last pic of the year.    With the boat put away, my attention can now be 100% focused on deer hunting, and a little trapping as well. Sunday I headed into the bush to retreive my trail camera cards. I was pleased with what has been visiting my stands. I have three cameras throughout 100 acres, and managed over 1700 pics combined in less than a week.  This guy has been visiting both of my favorite stands, usually very close behind a group of does/fawns. A little young, but I think I'd still take him if the opportunity came.       I'm seeing lots of these...     and these...       I think this one is sticking her tongue out at me...     Also, I allways get other wildlife. I'll get these fox and marten once the hunt is over!           Hope you enjoyed the pics! Stay safe.
awesome pics! I havent checked my cams in 3 weeks, but ill be at the camp all week starting sat
some very nice fall bronzebacks for sure !!!   and love those trail cam pics too..good luck on the hunt this fall...
Its like opening gifts on x-mas morning, ya never know what you'll get lol    Thanks
love seeing those trail cam pics.
Very cool Trail cam pics. I can imagine the excitement and anticipation of viewing for the first time.
Nice trail cam pics.  I shot my to c hit. Double odd buck, made sure of that. LOL   Dam deer were never there when I was.LOL  Thanks for sharing.
sounds like you have a good hunting plot. Best of luck this year Luc.  Those martens are really cool animals
Haha any pics?   Yes it is, and thanks!  Marten are very curious animals. I often see them when in the deer stand.
